# Recommended R packages

You can query the mpdb API easily via the elasticsearch R client and use the tidyverse suite to evaluate your data.

```{r setup}
if (!require('elastic')) install.packages('elastic')
if (!require('tidyverse')) install.packages('tidyverse')
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(elastic)
library(tidyverse)
```

# Setting up the API connection

```{r connection}
con <- connect(host = 'musikverlage.slub-dresden.de/api/search', port = 80, path = '', transport_schema = 'https')
#index_exists(con, 'published_item')
#Search_uri(con, index='published_item', size = 1)
#docs_get(con)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
